business.headline: Mukesh Ambani tops Hurun Rich List 2025, Shah Rukh Khan joins billionaire clubMukesh Ambani has reclaimed the top spot on the Hurun India Rich List 2025, while Bollywood superstar Shah Rukh Khan joins the billionaire club for the first time.

Sensex jumps 500 points: 3 reasons why markets are rising todayThe S&P BSE Sensex surged 660.64 points to 80,928.26, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 185.70 points to 24,796.80 as of 12:10 PM. The rally was broad-based on Dalal Street.

Government set to approve DA hike for employees and pensioners today: SourcesEarlier this year, the government had approved a 2% increase in DA in March, raising it from 53% to 55% of the basic salary and pension.

RBI announces big push for business reforms and easier lending. Details hereThe Reserve Bank of India has unveiled a set of measures aimed at making it easier for businesses to operate and improving access to loans. The reforms are expected to help companies, exporters, and banks alike.

RBI holds repo rate at 5.5%: How it impacts your EMIsBy keeping the repo rate unchanged at 5.5%, the RBI has signalled stability for borrowers. Home loan EMIs are likely to stay where they are, offering some relief to existing and new buyers.

RBI holds lending rate steady at 5.5%, maintains neutral stanceThe Reserve Bank of India (RBI) kept the key repo rate unchanged at 5.5% as the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC), led by Governor Sanjay Malhotra, concluded its three-day meeting. The central bank also maintained its neutral stance.

LG Electronics India IPO opens next week: 5 key details investors must knowLG Electronics is set to launch the third-largest IPO of 2025, after Tata Capital's Rs 15,500 crore issue scheduled between October 6 and October 8, and HDB Financial Services, which raised Rs 12,500 crore in June this year.
Sensex opens nearly 100 points higher, Nifty above 24,500; Sun Pharma up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 58.51 points to 80,326.13, while the NSE NIfty50 added 25.65 points to 24,636.75 as of 9:24 am.

RBI MPC decision today: Will there be a surprise rate cut?India has seen supportive fiscal measures this year, including changes in income tax slabs and GST cuts, which are expected to boost consumption during the festive season.

Government keeps PPF, NSC and other small savings rates unchanged. Check hereThe government has kept interest rates unchanged for key small savings schemes, including PPF and NSC, for the upcoming quarter.

LG Electronics India's Rs 15,000 crore IPO to open on October 7. Check detailsThe much-anticipated IPO of LG Electronics India, worth Rs 15,000 crore, is scheduled to open on October 7. Here's everything you need to know.

Behind the buffet: How restaurants profit from all-you-can-eat deals'All you can eat.' That is how buffets work. But then how do famous buffets such as BBQ Nation, The GT Road, and Pirates of Grill, with prices ranging from Rs 900-1400, make a profit serving unlimited food?

entertainment.headline: Bigg Boss 19: Farrhana and Kunickaa open up about family struggles and separation In 'Bigg Boss 19', Farrhana Bhatt and Kunickaa Sadanand shared deeply personal stories about family struggles, separation, and resilience.

FIR against Dimple Hayathi, husband by Hyderabad police over househelp complaint Hyderabad police have registered a case against actor Dimple Hayathi and her husband David following allegations of verbal abuse, harassment, and threats by their domestic worker, Priyanka Bibar. The complainant claimed she was insulted, denied proper food, and assaulted during a dispute at their Banjara Hills residence.

Exclusive: AR Rahman on whether he's seen K-pop hit Demon Hunters Oscar-winning composer AR Rahman discusses the rise of virtual musical groups and 'KPop Demon Hunters'. His new band Secret Mountain reflects a fusion of six cultures, signalling a shift in global pop culture dynamics.

Yash Raj Films launches YRF Script Cell to promote screen writers The YRF Script Cell aims at empowering screen writers to submit fresh ideas, according to Yash Raj Films. The Bollywood giants launched the initiative with a social media statement

Nicole Kidman may lose $11 million to Keith Urban over prenup cocaine clause Hollywood stars Nicole Kidman and Keith Urban reportedly split after nearly two decades together. A prenuptial agreement clause may result in Kidman owing Urban more than $11 million.

Pankaj Tripathi: I didn't use a toothbrush for 20 years, only neem twigs In an exclusive interaction with IndiaToday.in, actor Pankaj Tripathi recalled his childhood memory of not using a toothbrush till 20 years of age. The actor is currently shooting for 'Mirzapur: The Film.'

Kurukshetra trailer: Netflix's animated series on Mahabharata premieres October 10 Netflix released the trailer for 'Kurukshetra', an animated series based on the Mahabharata. The show explores the moral struggles of 18 warriors during the epic battle, offering a fresh perspective on the epic war.

BB19 episode 38: Nominations trigger major showdown between Nehal and Tanya In the latest 'Bigg Boss' episode, nominations sparked heated arguments and strategic plays, with Farrhana prioritising Nehal over Neelam and multiple contestants facing the nomination list. Personal stories and confrontations, including a major fight between Nehal and Tanya, added to the drama inside the house.

Tere Ishk Mein teaser: Dhanush as jilted lover set to destroy Kriti Sanon's world The teaser of Anand L Rai's 'Tere Ishk Mein' was unveiled today starring Dhanush and Kriti Sanon. The film promises a soulful love story with music by AR Rahman and releases worldwide in November 2025.
Sonam Kapoor and Anand Ahuja expecting their second child: Sources Actor Sonam Kapoor and Anand Ahuja are expecting their second child, as per sources. Official announcement to follow soon.

Tom Cruise and Ana de Armas planning a space wedding? Tom Cruise and Ana de Armas are reportedly planning an extraordinary wedding, possibly in outer space, reflecting their shared love for adventure and thrill.

Who is Vishal Brahma, SOTY 2 actor allegedly arrested with Rs 40 crore drugs? Struggling Bollywood actor Vishal Brahma was arrested at Chennai airport for allegedly trafficking methaqualone worth Rs 40 crore, reportedly linked to a Nigerian drug syndicate. Brahma, known for his role in 'Student of the Year 2', is believed to have been driven to the crime due to financial distress.

The chilling Guliga scream that made Kantara roar outside Karnataka When Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara' released in 2022, it seamlessly blended social commentary and tribal folklore. But what made it a masterpiece was the goosebumps-inducing scream of the Guliga Daiva.

They Call Him OG box office Day 6: Pawan Kalyan's film earns Rs 154 crore in a week 'They Call Him OG', starring Pawan Kalyan, continues to perform strongly at the box office, earning Rs 154 crore in its first week despite mixed reviews.

Mammootty arrives in Hyderabad for Patriot shoot, meets Anurag Kashyap Actor Mammootty arrived in Hyderabad for the new filming schedule of 'Patriot' amid health speculation. He was welcomed by filmmaker Anurag Kashyap at the hotel.

Madonna says embracing spirituality helped her deal with sepsis Madonna revealed details of her 2023 hospitalisation due to sepsis and how Kabbalah helped her recovery. Her experience highlights the role of spirituality and acceptance in overcoming serious illness.

Deepika Padukone claims top spot in new IMDb list, talks of challenging status quo Deepika Padukone ranked top among female actors in IMDb's 25-year Indian cinema report. She emphasised challenging norms and hopes to inspire future actors.

AI 'actress' Tilly Norwood denounced by Hollywood's SAG-AFTRA SAG-AFTRA, or the Screen Actors Guild and the American Federation of Television and Radio Artists, has denounced Tilly Norwood, the AI-generated 'actress' created by Eline Van der Velden

Shah Rukh Khan named India's most prolific star by IMDb IMDb report highlights Shah Rukh Khan's prominence in Indian cinema over 25 years. Shift in stardom dynamics with more actors sharing the spotlight in recent years.

general news.headline: Netanyahu's apology to Qatar, phone on Trump's lap: A telling White House photoTrump holds the phone, Bibi reads from script: Netanyahu's apology to Qatar PM

Mohsin Naqvi apologises to BCCI but adamant on not returning Asia Cup trophyPakistan Cricket Board chief Mohsin Naqvi has apologised to BCCI. However, the PCB chief remained adamant on not returning the winner's medals and Asia Cup trophy.

Karur stampede: Why is BJP going soft on Vijay?With assembly elections due next year, the BJP is desperate to avoid being pushed to the margins in Tamil Nadu. Annamalai wants to project the party as an assertive opposition that holds the DMK to account. At the same time, it cannot afford to cross swords with Vijay.

Government set to approve DA hike for employees and pensioners today: SourcesEarlier this year, the government had approved a 2% increase in DA in March, raising it from 53% to 55% of the basic salary and pension.

Near Chicken's Neck, India launches two rail lines to connect BhutanIndia has announced its first-ever railway links to Bhutan, which will enhance trade, tourism, and strategic connectivity. The Kokrajhar-Gelephu and Banarhat-Samtse lines near the strategic Chicken's Neck will integrate Bhutan with India's rail network while strengthening Northeast India's security and supply chains.

Dubai Sheikh looking for sex partner: Delhi molester baba's sleazy chats surfaceSwami Chaitanyananda Saraswati, the former head of a management institute in Vasant Kunj, was arrested in Agra last week after more than 15 women students accused him of molestation, blackmail and intimidation.

US government shuts down in 6-year first, may lead to mass layoffsThe 15th government shutdown since 1981 is set to halt the release of the closely watched September employment report, slow air travel, suspend scientific research, withhold pay for American troops, and furlough 750,000 federal workers -- costing the government $400 million each day.

Wah Trump ji wah! Opportunity that India shouldn't missAs US President Donald Trump pitches a Gaza peace plan in his bid for a Nobel Peace Prize, world leaders have rushed to applaud. India has lauded Trump's peace bid with PM Narendra Modi's message translated into seven world languages. This comes amid a low point in Indo-US ties. Trump has presented an opportunity and India must resort to realpolitik.

UP couple caught on CCTV stealing gold necklace worth Rs 6 lakh from jewellery shopA couple stole a gold necklace from a jewellery showroom in Bulandshahr. Police are investigating with CCTV footage to identify the accused soon.
Learn How Adobe Express Is Making Graphic Design Fun In ClassroomsThe Adobe Express app is available on any smart device or desktop computer.

Trump reposts Modi's support for Gaza peace plan without adding his own wordsDonald Trump reshared PM Modi's endorsement of his Gaza peace plan, which Modi called a "viable pathway" to lasting peace and security, urging all parties to unite behind Trump's initiative.

No congestion tax in Bengaluru. DK Shivakumar says infra projects will ease trafficKarnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar ruled out any congestion tax in Bengaluru. In a conversation with India Today, he said traffic solutions lie in infrastructure projects like ring roads and flyovers.

The chilling Guliga scream that made Kantara roar outside KarnatakaWhen Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara' released in 2022, it seamlessly blended social commentary and tribal folklore. But what made it a masterpiece was the goosebumps-inducing scream of the Guliga Daiva.

Demographic change bigger threat to social harmony than infiltration, warns PMWhile addressing the centenary celebrations of the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) in New Delhi today, the Prime Minister said that while"unity in diversity" is the soul of India, divisions fuelled by caste, language, regionalism, and extremist thinking could weaken the nation if not confronted.

Do children even need cough syrup? Rajasthan deaths revive the debateTwo children in Rajasthan died after consuming government-supplied cough syrup containing dextromethorphan. While the state government banned the syrup batch, it raises an urgent question: "Do we really need cough syrups?"

Indian medical student found dead in Dhaka, had been expelled for cheatingA 19-year-old Indian MBBS student was reportedly found hanging in her hostel room at Ad-Din Momin Medical College in Dhaka, after her expulsion for allegedly cheating in an exam. Nida was from Rajasthan's Jhalawar.

Tom Cruise and Ana de Armas planning a space wedding?Tom Cruise and Ana de Armas are reportedly planning an extraordinary wedding, possibly in outer space, reflecting their shared love for adventure and thrill.

Watch: Would be big insult to US if I don't get Nobel Prize, says Donald TrumpSpeaking at a high-profile military gathering, President Trump said that if his Gaza peace plan "works out, we'll have (solved) eight (wars) in eight months. That's pretty good. Nobody's ever done that." But he also insisted that the Nobel Peace Prize "would go to someone who didn't do a damn thing."

What would you have done if you were PM during Pahalgam attack? Owaisi repliesAsaduddin Owaisi refuses to entertain a question about his actions as a hypothetical Prime Minister during the Pahalgam terror attack, saying he concentrates on reality and his current political responsibilities instead of speculation.

Cycle-Breaking Parenting: Why younger generation is rewriting the rulebookIf you want to shield your little one from the negative experiences you faced as a child, you are moving toward a cycle-breaking parenting style. This approach not only helps your kid become emotionally stronger but also allows you to heal.

Philippines earthquake: Tectonic forces behind the 6.9 quake explainedThe death toll has climbed to at least 69, with more than 150 others injured as homes, churches, and public infrastructure suffered severe damage.

Voter list discrepancies in Maharashtra, Congress alleges 'vote theft'Allegations of large-scale voter list manipulation have surfaced in Maharashtra's Rajura assembly seat. Congress leaders claim fake voter enrolment and 'vote theft', raising concerns over electoral transparency in the region.

PCOS vs PCOD: It's not a disease, it's a syndrome says expertsPCOS and PCOD are often used interchangeably, but they are not the same. Experts explain how they differ, their symptoms, and which condition may require more medical attention.

75-year-old man marries 35-year-old woman in UP, dies next morningA 75-year-old man from Jaunpur died unexpectedly the day after marrying a 35-year-old woman. His family has raised suspicion over the cause of death and halted funeral proceedings pending further investigation.

FIR against Dimple Hayathi, husband by Hyderabad police over househelp complaintHyderabad police have registered a case against actor Dimple Hayathi and her husband David following allegations of verbal abuse, harassment, and threats by their domestic worker, Priyanka Bibar. The complainant claimed she was insulted, denied proper food, and assaulted during a dispute at their Banjara Hills residence.

Nicole Kidman may lose $11 million to Keith Urban over prenup cocaine clauseHollywood stars Nicole Kidman and Keith Urban reportedly split after nearly two decades together. A prenuptial agreement clause may result in Kidman owing Urban more than $11 million.

sports.headline: Women's World Cup: Guwahati sets new attendance record in opener The Women's ODI World Cup 2025 began at Barsapara Stadium in Guwahati, where India defeated Sri Lanka by 59 runs before a record-breaking crowd. Fans poured in numbers to watch the women's team.

PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi apologises to BCCI after Asia Cup trophy row Pakistan Cricket Board chief Mohsin Naqvi has issued an apology to the BCCI following the chaotic aftermath of the Asia Cup final on September 28. According to India Today, Naqvi took a conciliatory approach during the subsequent Asian Cricket Council meeting after the controversy in which he initially denied the Indian team the chance to celebrate their victory on the field with the winner's trophy.

Mohsin Naqvi apologises to BCCI but adamant on not returning Asia Cup trophy Pakistan Cricket Board chief Mohsin Naqvi has apologised to BCCI. However, the PCB chief remained adamant on not returning the winner's medals and Asia Cup trophy.

Amanjot Singh rocks press conference with one-liners after Guwahati heroics Women's World Cup 2025: All-rounder Amanjot Kaur was at her entertaining best in the press conference. The 25-year-old from Chandigarh, fresh from a match-winning knock against Sri Lanka in the tournament opener in Guwahati, lit up the room with her trademark one-liners off the field.

Will India shake hands with Pakistan in Colombo game? All-rounder ducks question Women's World Cup 2025: After the drama-filled Asia Cup, where politics and cricket became inseparable in the India-Pakistan clashes, the women's teams are set to meet in Colombo on Sunday. Following India's win over Sri Lanka in Guwahati, all-rounder Amanjot Kaur was asked whether Harmanpreet Kaur and her side would shake hands with their Pakistani counterparts.

Shakib Al Hasan will not play for Bangladesh again: Sports advisor The door to Shakib Al Hasan's Bangladesh return might have been shut permanently. Shakib, who has not played for Bangladesh in the past year, has fallen out with the country's sports advisor.

Neeraj watches Sumit Antil win javelin medal, shares inspirational message India's top javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra was in attendance as Sumit Antil broke the meet record to clinch World Para Athletics gold on Tuesday, September 30. After the event, Neeraj said that he would have loved to compete on the Mondo track in Delhi.

Vaibhav Suryavanshi hits 78-ball hundred in Brisbane youth Test, emulates McCullum 14-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi powered India U-19 into a dominant position in the first Youth Test against Australia U-19 with a blistering century, breaking multiple records at Ian Healy Oval in Brisbane.

ACC head Mohsin Naqvi refuses to hand over Asia Cup trophy to India: Report A controversy has followed the Asia Cup 2025 tournament, as Asian Cricket Council chief Mohsin Naqvi has refused to hand over the trophy to the BCCI vice president. Naqvi, who is also a Pakistan minister, has stated that Indian skipper Surya Kumar Yadav must visit the Asian Cricket Council to collect the trophy. In an interview with India Today's Nikhil Naaz, Surya Kumar Yadav addressed the situation, stating, "14 players and 10-12 support staff. That's the real trophy." He said the team's priority was to play cricket and they remained focused on the game, adding that winning the tournament was the best answer they could give to anyone. The standoff over the trophy handover continues.

Shakib Al Hasan will not play for Bangladesh again: Sports advisor The door to Shakib Al Hasan's Bangladesh return might have been shut permanently. Shakib, who has not played for Bangladesh in the past year, has fallen out with the country's sports advisor.

Neeraj watches Sumit Antil win javelin medal, shares inspirational message India's top javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra was in attendance as Sumit Antil broke the meet record to clinch World Para Athletics gold on Tuesday, September 30. After the event, Neeraj said that he would have loved to compete on the Mondo track in Delhi.

Naqvi, who is also a Pakistan minister, has stated that Indian skipper Surya Kumar Yadav must visit the Asian Cricket Council to collect the trophy. In an interview with India Today's Nikhil Naaz, Surya Kumar Yadav addressed the situation, stating, "14 players and 10-12 support staff. That's the real trophy." education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
